results.title: G-B 40 driving unit
results.creator_credit: Edward Cook and Big Six Film Unit
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the Huwood Hudswell G-B 40 model mine conveyor unit driving both a top and bottom belt gate conveyor. The complete unit is seen working in a Midlands colliery illustrating that with the acute shortage of manpower existing in the British coal mining industry, equipment such as this is raising the output of each worker.

results.title: The Cat = Il Gatto
results.creator_credit: Michele Gandin, Roberto Capanno and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Scenes of Siamese kittens at play with commentary in Italian. Shows care of the kittens by mother cats at play and at feeding time. Child and adult alternate with commentary.

results.title: Gathering of the clans
results.brief_description: Scenes at the Gathering of the Clans held at Inverness in 1966. Traditional dancing, sports and the pipe band contest are shown. The history of Scottish culture as represented at the Gathering is briefly discussed.

results.title: Gateway to independence
results.brief_description: A guide dog gives independence to a blind person. Shows the careful selection and training of dogs and the training of the people who will use these dogs as aids to daily living. It stresses that complete confidence in the dog by its owner is essential for the success of the enterprise. Cinematography by Tom Cowan.

results.title: Dr Fred D. Miller and the gateway to health
results.creator_credit: Robert Edmonds, John Ott and John Ott Pictures
results.brief_description: General physical health and hygiene practices as the basis of good dental health. A practising dentist shows how errors of diet and poor dental hygiene lead to poor teeth and avoidable cavities. Patients who have eaten the right foods all their lives and made a practice of finishing a meal with a crisp fruit have near-perfect teeth when in their fifties.
results.title_for_label: Dr Fred D. Miller and the gateway to health

results.title: Gateway to charm
results.brief_description: the tourist attractions of the north coast of Tasmania. The towns of Wynyard, Burnie, Stanley, Penguin, Ulverston and Devonport are shown, with their beaches, ocean and fresh-water fishing, sporting and camping facilities, and natural scenic attractions. The beauties of the rocky coast are displayed. Aboriginal rock paintings, fossils and the ruins of pioneer settlements can also be seen.

results.title: Gates of power
results.brief_description: A description of some of the hydro-electric schemes in the British Isles showing how this power is harnessed and some of the difficulties which have to be overcome. The film also shows the Karapiro Dam under construction in New Zealand which, when completed, will be one of the largest in the world. Turbo-generators, made in Britain, are being installed at this dam.

results.title: Gastronomy = La Gastronomie
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson, Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Quebec has a long tradition of good eating, but the haute cuisine served at the autumn banquet of the ‘Le Club Prosper Montagne’ is something that must be seen to be believed. This club is one of the oldest, most exclusive dining clubs in Quebec. Through the film cameras, you savour the elaborate, twelve course dinner with vintage wines, prepared by Chef of the Year Marcel Kretz at Hotel La Sapiniere in the Laurentians.

results.title: Gastro-enteritis in infancy
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Prevention of Cross Infection”.
Illustrates the prevention of cross-infection by contact and the techniques of cubicle nursing of specific complaints. A specific case is analysed, showing the general precautionary techniques of “barrier” nursing, and the possible consequences if even a single rule is not observed.
